answer_to_complaint.description: Answer must be filed within 20 days after service of original process (Pa.R.C.P. § 1026)
exceptions: Extended to 30 days if service is by mail
Extended when service is outside Pennsylvania

motion_to_dismiss.description: Preliminary objections must be filed within 20 days after service of complaint
exceptions: May be filed with leave of court after deadline
Must be filed before answer to preserve defenses

interrogatories.description: Response to interrogatories must be served within 30 days (Pa.R.C.P. § 4007)

requests_for_admission.description: Response to requests for admission must be served within 30 days (Pa.R.C.P. § 4014)

deposition_notice.description: Notice of deposition must be served at least 10 days before deposition

motion_filing.description: Notice of motion must be served at least 5 days before hearing
exceptions: Extended by 3 days if served by mail
Emergency motions may be heard on shorter notice

appeal_deadline.description: Notice of Appeal must be filed within 30 days after entry of order (Pa.R.A.P. § 903)

notice_period.description: Ex parte applications require reasonable notice unless immediate irreparable harm is shown

filing_time.description: Ex parte applications typically heard at morning motion session

requirements: Verified complaint or affidavit showing specific facts
Certificate of good faith effort to notify or explanation why notice should not be required
Affidavit showing diligent search and inquiry
Service on adult member of household at residence
Mailing copy to defendant's last known address

service_by_mail.description: Service by mail extends response time by 3 days (Pa.R.C.P. § 1011)

electronic_service.description: Electronic service extends response time by 1 day

court_fees.fee_waiver_form: Petition to Proceed In Forma Pauperis
